ArticleTitle.sentence: The ubiquitous octamer-binding protein(s) is sufficient for transcription of immunoglobulin genes.

event.clue: The ubiquitous octamer-binding protein(s) is sufficient for transcription of immunoglobulin genes.
The ubiquitous octamer-binding protein(s) is sufficient for transcription of immunoglobulin genes.

AbstractText.sentence: All immunoglobulin genes contain a conserved octanucleotide promoter element, ATGCAAAT, which has been shown to be required for their normal B-cell-specific transcription.

event.clue: All immunoglobulin genes contain a conserved octanucleotide promoter element, ATGCAAAT, which has been shown to be required for their normal B-cell-specific transcription.
All immunoglobulin genes contain a conserved octanucleotide promoter element, ATGCAAAT, which has been shown to be required for their normal B-cell-specific transcription.

AbstractText.sentence: Proteins that bind this octamer have been purified, and cDNAs encoding octamer-binding proteins have been cloned.

event.clue: Proteins that bind this octamer have been purified, and cDNAs encoding octamer-binding proteins have been cloned.

AbstractText.sentence: Some of these proteins (referred to as OTF-2) are lymphoid specific, whereas at least one other, and possibly more (referred to as OTF-1), is found ubiquitously in all cell types.
The exact role of these different proteins in directing the tissue-specific expression of immunoglobulin genes is unclear.

event.clue: The exact role of these different proteins in directing the tissue-specific expression of immunoglobulin genes is unclear.
The exact role of these different proteins in directing the tissue-specific expression of immunoglobulin genes is unclear.
The exact role of these different proteins in directing the tissue-specific expression of immunoglobulin genes is unclear.

AbstractText.sentence: We have identified two human pre-B-cell lines that contain extremely low levels of OTF-2 yet still express high levels of steady-state immunoglobulin heavy-chain mRNA in vivo and efficiently transcribe an immunoglobulin gene in vitro.

event.clue: We have identified two human pre-B-cell lines that contain extremely low levels of OTF-2 yet still express high levels of steady-state immunoglobulin heavy-chain mRNA in vivo and efficiently transcribe an immunoglobulin gene in vitro.

We have identified two human pre-B-cell lines that contain extremely low levels of OTF-2 yet still express high levels of steady-state immunoglobulin heavy-chain mRNA in vivo and efficiently transcribe an immunoglobulin gene in vitro.

AbstractText.sentence: Addition of a highly enriched preparation of OTF-1 made from one of these pre-B cells or from HeLa cells specifically stimulated in vitro transcription of an immunoglobulin gene.

event.clue: Addition of a highly enriched preparation of OTF-1 made from one of these pre-B cells or from HeLa cells specifically stimulated in vitro transcription of an immunoglobulin gene.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, OFT-1 appeared to have approximately the same transactivation ability as OTF-2 when normalized for binding activity.

event.clue: Furthermore, OFT-1 appeared to have approximately the same transactivation ability as OTF-2 when normalized for binding activity.

AbstractText.sentence: These results suggest that OTF-1, without OTF-2, is sufficient for transcription of immunoglobulin genes and that OTF-2 alone is not responsible for the B-cell-specific regulation of immunoglobulin gene expression.

event.clue: These results suggest that OTF-1, without OTF-2, is sufficient for transcription of immunoglobulin genes and that OTF-2 alone is not responsible for the B-cell-specific regulation of immunoglobulin gene expression.
